definition[0]: money that you have to pay in addition to the basic price of something
definition[1]: to make someone pay an additional amount of money
definition[2]: money that has to be paid in addition to the normal payment for something
example[1]: Taxpayers would beliable to surcharges if they failed to send in payments.
example[2]: Trade has been hampered  (=harmed) by high Chinese surcharges on South Korean products.
example[3]: The company recentlyimposed surcharges of as much as $56 a day on car rentals in certain areas.
example[4]: Retailers will be able to choose whether to surcharge credit card customers or to offer a discount for cash.
